result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R. Peo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted huber privileges for work or counseling or as allowed by jail.  Defendant may serve sentence in another county.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving
Clark County Case 2016CM24 is dismissed and read in to this case.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.    Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is to have no association with any person that uses or is in possession of drugs or any controlled substance.    The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.    The defendant shall attend counseling as directed by the agent, and shall make all counseling records available to the Department of Corrections.
Defendant is to complete Drug and Alcohol Assessment.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant is granted huber privileges for work, counseling or as jail allows.  Defendant may serve sentence in other county.   Defendant has 48 days credit.
Consecutive to: any sentence defendant is serving

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Brian R. Peo, in custody, appeared with Attorney Charles David Betthauser.  Clark County Case 2016CM24 is Dismissed and Read In to this case.  Preliminary hearing is waived by defendant.  Waived further reading of the complaint by Attorney Betthauser.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 is to be Dismissed and Read In.  Court accepts defendant's guilty plea to Count 1 and finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court finds defendant is a repeat offender.  Court dismisses and reads in Count 2 and Clark County Case 2016CM24.
